<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DATING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/tinder-rolls-biggest-update-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Slow and Steady Wins the Date
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of Tinder's pink and orange fire logo in 3D. A mint-colored surgical mask is hanging off its side. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTE3L3RpbmRlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Tinder announced some of the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/22/22538970/tinder-video-explore-tab-hot-takes-launch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest changes</a> since its 2012 launch to adapt to a pandemic-altered dating landscape. Some new features...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Videos: </strong></span><span>Tinder is letting users attach up to nine short videos to their profiles.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Hot Takes: </strong></span><span>Users can discuss their spiciest opinions </span><span><em>before</em></span><span> matching, available 6pm to midnight on weekdays.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Explore: </strong></span><span>A mode that lets you scan the virtual room before going in and striking up a conversation. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If this all sounds like Tinder attempting to become the next TikTok, you’d be half-right. Gen Z accounts for over 50% of Tinder’s user base, and adding videos and opportunities to display an “authentic” self is intended to attract more young adults to the app. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But CEO Jim Lanzone <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-57557180?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stressed</a> that the company isn’t trying to become a social media platform for friends. The end goal is still to foster romantic relationships, but with pandemic-era tweaks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Users coming out of Covid “just want to slow things down and get to know people first a lot more before they decide to match, let alone before they decide to go meet someone offline,” Lanzone told the BBC.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Some dating apps are taking a different approach</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bumble, an app known for requiring women to make the first move, is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/idCAKCN2DY0CR-OCATC?edition-redirect=ca" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubling down</a> on its “Bumble BFF” feature to help nurture IRL friendships. Bumble BFF accounted for 9% of the app’s monthly active users in September 2020, CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd told Reuters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And Match Group, which owns Tinder, recently acquired a South Korean company, Hyperconnect, that promotes conversations across borders and languages.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With lockdowns mostly over, people are turning to dating apps to find new friends, benefits included or not.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/us-likely-wont-hit-vaccination-goal-fourth-july-says-white-house?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Don’t Pull Out the Sparklers Just Yet...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Biden administration <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/22/us/politics/biden-covid-vaccine-july-4.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acknowledged</a> that it’ll come up just short of reaching its goal of partially vaccinating 70% of US adults by July 4. If the current pace of vaccinations continues, 67% of adults will have at least one shot of a Covid vaccine by the time the fireworks start, according to the NYT.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People around Biden say, “Ehhh, close enough,” as they talk up the big rebound in the economy, which is projected by the Fed to grow 7% this year. But the miss reflects significant vaccine hesitancy in the US and the waning power of financial incentives to get people off their couch and into Walgreens. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And a major threat looms</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Covid’s hottest variant is delta, a more transmissible strain spreading around the globe that Dr. Fauci called the “<a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/06/22/coronavirus-covid-live-updates-us/?utm_source=morning_brew#link-CTLUEE5ZAZH5FJYF7UNE63UDQQ" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">greatest threat</a>” to eliminating the pandemic in the US. Vaccines have been shown to protect against delta, but experts are warning of surges in regions with lower vaccination rates—like the South—this fall and winter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Health officials are painting a portrait of “<a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jun/20/us-covid-delta-variant-spreads-vaccination-rates-drop?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two Americas</a>,” one in regions with high immunization rates and the other where they lag.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F06%2F22%2Fus-likely-wont-hit-vaccination-goal-fourth-july-says-white-house" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/blackstone-buy-rental-firm-home-partners-america-6b?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Now Renting: Natural Blackstone Exterior
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Blackstone is getting back into the rough-and-tumble business of arguing about where to hang the photos. The investment firm is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/blackstone-bets-6-billion-on-buying-and-renting-homes-11624359600?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spending $6 billion</a> to acquire Home Partners of America, a rental company with 17k+ properties that gives tenants the opportunity to eventually buy their house.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Getting </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>back</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> into? </strong>After the 2008 crash, Wall Street firms like Blackstone scooped up foreclosed homes on the cheap. Their investments <a href="https://www.vox.com/22524829/wall-street-housing-market-blackrock-bubble?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are credited</a> with helping to stabilize local housing markets and prop up prices.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Blackstone bought tens of thousands of units and rented them out through Invitation Homes, now the US’ largest single-family home renter. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But without a crystal ball to predict the pandemic-induced scramble for housing, Blackstone sold Invitation Homes in 2019. Now, the firm (and others) want back in on the soaring housing market, where last month median home prices <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-economy-housing/u-s-existing-home-sales-decline-as-prices-surge-to-record-high-idUSL2N2O01ZE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a> almost 24% annually to break $350k. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Institutional investors only account for an estimated 2% of single-family rentals. But all-cash offers from Wall Street suits are frustrating some would-be homebuyers who are already up against short supplies, record-high prices, and intense competition. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>5.2 million people around the globe <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/86b99144-ba71-441d-b297-ddcdc94ea7f2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became dollar millionaires</a> last year despite the pandemic, according to a new report from Credit Suisse. 90% of millionaires currently have a net worth of $5 million or less, while 0.4% are worth $50 million or more. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Very, very unlikely.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In testimony before Congress, Fed Chair Jerome Powell <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/22/feds-powell-very-very-unlikely-the-us-will-see-1970s-style-inflation.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dismissed</a> the idea that the economy could experience 1970s-esque hyperinflation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The rise of the $10 million disc golf celebrity. <tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/airlines-struggle-handle-surge-unruly-passengers-inflight-violence?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Is Why We Can’t Have Nice Flights
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/22/airlines-struggle-handle-surge-unruly-passengers-inflight-violence?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Joke from the movie Airplane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=350 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7qE2HzB4rOFQr4zK/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Joke from the movie Airplane " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7qE2HzB4rOFQr4zK/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sure, flight attendants might be trained in handling a drunk bachelorette party or two. But abusive passengers have become so common on flights that on Monday airline groups <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/21/politics/airline-unruly-passengers-justice-department/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pleaded</a> with the Justice Department to prosecute the worst cases.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since the beginning of the year, the FAA has received 3,000 reports of unruly passengers—2,300 of whom were people who refused to follow mask requirements.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“It’s </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/22/its-out-of-control-airlines-flight-attendants-want-stiffer-penalties-for-unruly-passengers.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">out of control</a></span><span>. It’s really coming to the point where we have to defend ourselves,” Paul Hartshorn, spokesperson for the Association of Professional Flight Attendants, told CNBC.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In one instance, a passenger was fined $52k for hitting a crew member in the face and trying to open the cockpit door.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No one’s 100% sure why people increasingly want to fight someone who hands out Biscoffs, but experts point to entitlement, anxieties from the pandemic, and politicized mask-wearing for the unruly behavior. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> In general, airlines are struggling to accommodate the rebound in demand. American is cutting 1% of July flights and Delta <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/21/delta-plans-to-hire-1000-pilots-by-next-summer-as-travel-demand-surges.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to hire 1,000 more pilots by next summer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">While we’re here...</strong>Someone needs to take away the <a href="https://twitter.com/FAANews/status/1407441052538228739?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FAA’s</a> photoshop.</p>

A mint-colored surgical mask is hanging off its side. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTE3L3RpbmRlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Tinder announced some of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/22/22538970/tinder-video-explore-tab-hot-takes-launch?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest changes\u003c/a\u003e since its 2012 launch to adapt to a pandemic-altered dating landscape. Some new features...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVideos: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTinder is letting users attach up to nine short videos to their profiles.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHot Takes: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUsers can discuss their spiciest opinions \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ebefore\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e matching, available 6pm to midnight on weekdays.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eExplore: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA mode that lets you scan the virtual room before going in and striking up a conversation. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf this all sounds like Tinder attempting to become the next TikTok, you’d be half-right. Gen Z accounts for over 50% of Tinder’s user base, and adding videos and opportunities to display an “authentic” self is intended to attract more young adults to the app. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut CEO Jim Lanzone \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-57557180?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estressed\u003c/a\u003e that the company isn’t trying to become a social media platform for friends. The end goal is still to foster romantic relationships, but with pandemic-era tweaks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUsers coming out of Covid “just want to slow things down and get to know people first a lot more before they decide to match, let alone before they decide to go meet someone offline,” Lanzone told the BBC.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSome dating apps are taking a different approach\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBumble, an app known for requiring women to make the first move, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/idCAKCN2DY0CR-OCATC?edition-redirect=ca\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubling down\u003c/a\u003e on its “Bumble BFF” feature to help nurture IRL friendships. Bumble BFF accounted for 9% of the app’s monthly active users in September 2020, CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd told Reuters.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd Match Group, which owns Tinder, recently acquired a South Korean company, Hyperconnect, that promotes conversations across borders and languages.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith lockdowns mostly over, people are turning to dating apps to find new friends, benefits included or not.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" If the current pace of vaccinations continues, 67% of adults will have at least one shot of a Covid vaccine by the time the fireworks start, according to the NYT.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePeople around Biden say, “Ehhh, close enough,” as they talk up the big rebound in the economy, which is projected by the Fed to grow 7% this year. But the miss reflects significant vaccine hesitancy in the US and the waning power of financial incentives to get people off their couch and into Walgreens. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd a major threat looms\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCovid’s hottest variant is delta, a more transmissible strain spreading around the globe that Dr. Fauci called the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/06/22/coronavirus-covid-live-updates-us/?utm_source=morning_brew#link-CTLUEE5ZAZH5FJYF7UNE63UDQQ\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egreatest threat\u003c/a\u003e” to eliminating the pandemic in the US. Vaccines have been shown to protect against delta, but experts are warning of surges in regions with lower vaccination rates—like the South—this fall and winter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eHealth officials are painting a portrait of “\u003ca Exterior\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlackstone is getting back into the rough-and-tumble business of arguing about where to hang the photos. The investment firm is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/blackstone-bets-6-billion-on-buying-and-renting-homes-11624359600?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espending $6 billion\u003c/a\u003e to acquire Home Partners of America, a rental company with 17k+ properties that gives tenants the opportunity to eventually buy their house.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGetting \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eback\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e into? \u003c/strong\u003eAfter the 2008 crash, Wall Street firms like Blackstone scooped up foreclosed homes on the cheap. Their investments \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/22524829/wall-street-housing-market-blackrock-bubble?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare credited\u003c/a\u003e with helping to stabilize local housing markets and prop up prices.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlackstone bought tens of thousands of units and rented them out through Invitation Homes, now the US’ largest single-family home renter. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut without a crystal ball to predict the pandemic-induced scramble for housing, Blackstone sold Invitation Homes in 2019. Now, the firm (and others) want back in on the soaring housing market, where last month median home prices \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/usa-economy-housing/u-s-existing-home-sales-decline-as-prices-surge-to-record-high-idUSL2N2O01ZE?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose\u003c/a\u003e almost 24% annually to break $350k. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Institutional investors only account for an estimated 2% of single-family rentals. But all-cash offers from Wall Street suits are frustrating some would-be homebuyers who are already up against short supplies, record-high prices, and intense competition. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSure, flight attendants might be trained in handling a drunk bachelorette party or two. But abusive passengers have become so common on flights that on Monday airline groups \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/21/politics/airline-unruly-passengers-justice-department/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epleaded\u003c/a\u003e with the Justice Department to prosecute the worst cases.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince the beginning of the year, the FAA has received 3,000 reports of unruly passengers—2,300 of whom were people who refused to follow mask requirements.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“It’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/22/its-out-of-control-airlines-flight-attendants-want-stiffer-penalties-for-unruly-passengers.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eout of control\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. It’s really coming to the point where we have to defend ourselves,” Paul Hartshorn, spokesperson for the Association of Professional Flight Attendants, told CNBC.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn one instance, a passenger was fined $52k for hitting a crew member in the face and trying to open the cockpit door.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNo one’s 100% sure why people increasingly want to fight someone who hands out Biscoffs, but experts point to entitlement, anxieties from the pandemic, and politicized mask-wearing for the unruly behavior. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e In general, airlines are struggling to accommodate the rebound in demand.
